revised_title: Numerical Integration Formulae and Approximate Product-Integration
tldr: The author presents a method for obtaining numerical integration formulae using approximate product-integration. The method involves calculating weights and abscissae for polynomial expansions and can be applied to various types of expansions, including Taylor, exponential, and orthogonal functions. The author also discusses the use of matrix methods and provides examples of Newton-Cotes formulae for equal-interval end-point and mid-point cases.
